meanings.sent1: The rain during the picnic was infelicitous, ruining our outdoor plans.
meanings.sent2: It was infelicitous timing for the power outage to happen during the important presentation.
meanings.sent3: It was quite infelicitous that I wore my new white shoes on a muddy day.
meanings.sent4: The infelicitous choice of words led to a misunderstanding between the friends.
meanings.sent5: The infelicitous news of the canceled flight dampened their excitement for the trip.

meanings.sent1: Her infelicitous outfit choice for the formal event raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent2: The infelicitous design of the building made it difficult for people to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The infelicitous combination of flavors in the dish made it unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: His infelicitous attempt at humor fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The infelicitous placement of the sign caused confusion among the visitors.
